intro: Joannesia princeps, commonly known as the Amazonian beauty or the royal beauty, is a rare flowering plant native to the dense rainforests of South America. It is characterized by its striking, large, and showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant has a unique structure with a single, elongated flower that emerges from a leaf-like bract. Joannesia princeps is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from deforestation and habitat loss.
